en: Angular CLI (Command Line Interface) is a vital tool for developing Angular applications with speed and efficiency. It provides a seamless experience by automating common tasks and offering powerful command-line utilities.

In this concise guide, we'll walk you through the essential features of Angular CLI. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, you'll gain insights into project setup, code generation, testing, optimization, and more.

By leveraging Angular CLI, you can streamline your development workflow, increase productivity, and build high-quality Angular applications with ease. Let's dive in and unlock the full potential of Angular CLI!
fr: Angular CLI (Interface en ligne de commande) est un outil essentiel pour développer des applications Angular rapidement et efficacement. Il offre une expérience fluide en automatisant les tâches courantes et en proposant des utilitaires puissants en ligne de commande.

Dans ce guide concis, nous vous guiderons à travers les fonctionnalités essentielles d'Angular CLI. Que vous soyez débutant ou développeur expérimenté, vous obtiendrez des informations sur la configuration du projet, la génération de code, les tests, l'optimisation et bien plus encore.

En utilisant Angular CLI, vous pouvez rationaliser votre flux de travail de développement, augmenter votre productivité et créer facilement des applications Angular de haute qualité. Plongeons-y et exploitons pleinement le potentiel d'Angular CLI !

en.title: Install Angular CLI
en.description: The npm install -g @angular/cli command is used to globally install the Angular CLI...

en.title: Create project
en.description: The ng new name-of-the-project command is used to create a new Angular project...

en.title: Create a new module
en.description: The ng g m name-of-the-middle command is used to generate a new Angular module...

en.title: Serve the application
en.description: The ng serve command is used to build and serve your Angular application locally...

en.title: Build the application
en.description: The ng build command is used to build your Angular application for production...

en.title: Generate a new component
en.description: The ng g c name-of-the-component command is used to generate a new Angular component...

en.title: Run unit tests
en.description: The ng test command is used to run unit tests for your Angular application...

en.title: Run end-to-end tests
en.description: The ng e2e command is used to run end-to-end (e2e) tests for your Angular application...

en.title: Update Angular dependencies
en.description: The ng update command is used to update the Angular dependencies in your project...

en.title: Generate a new service
en.description: The ng g s name-of-the-service command is used to generate a new Angular service...

en.title: Lint the code
en.description: The ng lint command is used to run the linting process on your Angular project's code...

en.title: Generate a new directive
en.description: The ng g d name-of-the-directive command is used to generate a new Angular directive...

en.title: Run the application in a production-like environment
en.description: The ng serve --prod command is used to serve the Angular application in a production-like environment...

en.title: Create a new component with a specific file extension
en.description: The ng g c name-of-the-component --skip-tests --style=scss command is used to generate a new Angular component with specific options...

en.title: Create a new Angular library
en.description: The ng generate library name-of-the-library command is used to create a new Angular library...
